question: An Airbus A320 is to conduct an instrument approach to a high altitude runaway with very high ambient temperature. Performance calculations indicate that at its minimum practicable landing mass (after dumping fuel to minimum acceptable reserves) its maximum attainable climb gradient following engine failure will be 2.4%. Which of the following is true.

choices.choice: It cannot carry out an instrument approach.
It cannot land at this field.
The instrument landing can be carried out provided decision height is at least 200 ft.
The landing must be abandoned if an engine fails during the approach.

subject: Performance

question: LDR will be increased by?

choices.choice: High mass, high density, uphill runway slope.
High mass, low density, downhill runway slope.
Low mass, low density, uphill runway slope.
Low mass, high density, downhill runway slope.

question: Which of the following best defines the measured landing distance?

choices.choice: LDA x a safety factor of 1.3.
LDA x a safety factor of 1.45.
Horizontal distance between attaining screen height and the point at which the aircraft comes to a full stop when landing on a hard dry surface.
Horizontal distance between attaining a screen height to the point at which the aircraft comes to a full stop on whatever surface it is landing on.

question: When landing on a grass runway?

choices.choice: LDR will decrease due to increased rolling resistance through the grass.
LDR will increase due to reduced friction between the tyres and the surface.
LDR will be unaffected unless the grass is wet or very long.
LDR will increase due to aquaplaning.

question: If the thrust reverse system is unserviceable it will cause?

LDR and maximum landing mass to increase.
LDR to decrease and maximum landing mass to increase.
LDR to decrease and VREF to increase.

question: An aircraft is programmed to fly to an airfield with a single runway on which there is predicted to be a 15 Kt tailwind at the time of its arrival. Performance calculations show that although the aircraft can comply with the still air requirement, it cannot do so with the predicted tailwind. Which of the following is true?

choices.choice: The flight cannot take place until the'tailwind has subsided to enable full compliance.
The flight can be planned provided at least two suitable diversion fields enabling full compliance are available.
The flight can take place provided at least one suitable diversion field enabling full compliance is available.
The flight can take place because only the still air requirements are mandatory.

subject: Performance

The clearway. It is used for steep approaches.
An area free of obstructions located immediately before the threshold, It is required for short landings.
An area free of obstructions immediately before the threshold. It is used for all take-offs and landings.
